text:
Of Forgiveness and Fear

A dimly lit room, tension thick.  
His voice trembles, vulnerability exposed.  
Raskolnikov: “Of course you’re right, Sonia.”  

Sonia: “What’s the matter?”  
Raskolnikov: “I... I was asking forgiveness.”  

His head bows, despair settles in.  
Raskolnikov: “I felt... bitter hatred for you.”  

Sonia: “No! Look at me!”  
Raskolnikov: “I can’t... I don’t understand.”  

---  

A small bed, Raskolnikov sits, lost.  
Sonia approaches, concern etched on her face.  
Sonia: “What’s happening to you?”  

Raskolnikov: “I must not lose another minute.”  
Sonia: “Please, just talk to me!”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov experiences a profound internal conflict as he seeks forgiveness from Sonia, revealing his vulnerability and confusion.
